_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Cloverleaf Cold Storage Co. operates a refrigerated warehouse facility at 444 Gilbert Rd,

Benson, NC.

A trained refrigeration engineer operates the ammonia refrigeration system. The system is comprised of

various refrigeration components including compressors, evaporators, vessels, pumps, heat exchangers and

condensers. The ammonia refrigeration system is operated with a variety of safety devices employed within

the system, included are high and low pressure and level automated shutdown systems. Alarm systems are

utilized to provide early detection of problems within the system before shutdowns occur. Cloverleaf plants

are monitored by a computerized system. Each system is linked to a twenty-four hours a day third-party

alarm monitoring company. Ammonia sensors are strategically placed throughout the facility to monitor for

releases of ammonia. Based on the readings from these sensors the system will do the following:

Freezer/Cooler Rooms:

At readings of 40 PPM the system will trigger an alarm with the third-party alarm monitoring company

who in turn will notify trained staff on the designated call list. Refer to Personnel response to a potential

ammonia release below for further maintenance response.

At readings of 80 PPM the system will close all valve banks serving the affected room.

Engine Room:

At readings of 150 PPM the system will trigger the exhaust fan to ventilate the room and send an alarm

to the third-party alarm monitoring company who in turn will notify trained staff on the designated call list.

Refer to Personnel response to a potential ammonia release below for further maintenance response.

At readings of 4,000 PPM the system will shut down all equipment in the engine room.

At readings of 10,000 PPM the system will shut down power to the entire facility.

Cloverleaf personnel are not trained to respond to an Emergency Situation; therefore emergency services are

contacted. Our emergency response program provides response actions f

or employees. These include: what

to do if an ammonia smell is detected, proper evacuation procedures and meeting locations. Cloverleaf

conducts a Fire/Ammonia Leak drill annually to ensure procedures are being followed and are effective.
